DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior First-Line Chemotherapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to having at least one prior line of chemotherapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior First-Line Chemotherapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Earlier in time or order._The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior First-Line Therapy Chemotherapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient has had at least one
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has had at least one prior line of chemotherapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has newly diagnosed diffuse anaplastic Wilms tumor, has the patient had any prior chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior first-line treatment must have consisted of 4-6 cycles of 1st-line therapy (platinum-based chemotherapy; gemcitabine-cisplatin, gemcitabine-carboplatin, MVAC or ddMVAC).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: First-line treatment in locally advanced/metastatic setting before study enrollment must have consisted of 4-6 cycles of 1st-line therapy (platinum-based chemotherapy; gemcitabine-cisplatin, gemcitabine-carboplatin, MVAC or ddMVAC), or other cisplatin or carboplatin-containing regimen last dose of first-line chemotherapy must have been received no less than 3 weeks, and no more than 10 weeks, prior to randomization.
